title: Rubel Phillips
text:
Rubel Lex Phillips (March 29, 1925 – June 18, 2011) was an American <a href="politician">politician</a> from the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Mississippi">Mississippi</a>.
Phillips was a <a href="circuit%20court">circuit court</a> <a href="judge">judge</a> and a <a href="U.S.%20Democratic%20Party">Democrat</a>. But in <a href="1963%20Mississippi%20gubernatorial%20election">1963</a>, he ran for <a href="Governor%20of%20Mississippi">Governor of Mississippi</a> as a <a href="U.S.%20Republican%20Party">Republican</a>. Phillips was only the third Republican to run for governor since 1877. Phillips ran on the slogan of "K.O. <a href="Kennedy%20political%20family">the Kennedys</a>". Phillips lost to <a href="Paul%20B.%20Johnson%2C%20Jr.">Paul B. Johnson, Jr.</a> by over 86,000 votes while winning 38 percent of the vote. Phillips ran again in 1967 and lost to the more <a href="conservative">conservative</a> Democrat <a href="John%20Bell%20Williams">John Bell Williams</a> by almost 182,000 votes while winning 29.7% of the vote.
